alert.note: Alert for Adair; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 3:56AM CDT until April 14 at 3:06PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River near Watts affecting Adair and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River near Watts. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from the Arkansas border to near Fidler`s Bend. Extreme turbulence makes the river unsafe for floating. At 15.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from the Arkansas border to near Fidler`s Bend. Permanent campgrounds are affected. Extreme turbulence makes the river unsafe for floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting and will begin falling later today. It is expected to fall below flood stage by midday today and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
